title: Review: Kogel Kolossos OS pulley cage looks loud, but shifts oh so smooth & quiet
content:
There was a time when a 10-42 cassette on a mountain bike looked ridiculous. Then, seemingly overnight, it looked normal. And then their 50, 51, and 52-tooth successors quickly looked normal, too. To the point where a 36-tooth mountain bike cassette now looks anemic by comparison. And such is the case after having installed the [â€¦]

The post Review: Kogel Kolossos OS pulley cage looks loud, but shifts oh so smooth & quiet appeared first on Bikerumor.
author: Tyler Benedict
